alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 1:45AM PST until January 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow with periods of white-out conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 25 to 45 inches in the Cascades, and 10 to 20 inches in the Siskiyous. Winds gusting to around 45 to 65 mph across exposed terrain. * WHERE...Southern Oregon Cascades and Siskiyou Mountains, including all passes and significant portions of Interstate 5, and Highways 66, 140, 62, 138, 230, and 58. * WHEN...From 1 AM Tuesday to 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall and strongest winds are expected between 10 PM Tuesday and 10 AM Wednesday, with rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour expected. Blizzard conditions are possible with a 55% chance for this occuring. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
